website_summaries.verdict: Reusable breast pads that stay dry and fit well without curving or bunching.
pros: Microfiber middle designed to wick moisture away
Slightly fitted and do a good job of not showing under your shirt
cons: These pads only come in one diameter

customer_reviews.title: Work great during the day and night (I have an established ...
customer_reviews.text: I don't even notice that I'm wearing them! Work great during the day and night (I have an established milk supply). They lay really well and don't slide around (I wear nursing bras or nursing camisoles) and for that reason I prefer them to Bamboobies. Just ordered another set for an expecting friend too! UPDATE: 6/15/17 - still loving the nursing pads and wear them daily/ nightly! They tend to pill a little bit over time but still look and feel great! No issues with stitching. Included is my full video review of this product.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: So so
customer_reviews.text: I figured buying these would help me to save money on the disposable breast pads that I've previously worn. These are pretty good for saving money, yet if you have sensitive skin they may not be the best as they can sometimes make your nipples itch slightly. Not sure why. They do absorb, bit you can sometimes smell the milk if you have worn them for a full day and leak a lot. They are leakproof and somewhat soft material, just can sometimes make you feel wet. Great money saver, just have to be for the right person. For me, they are just so so. I like my breast cups better that catch the leaking milk.
customer_reviews.author: Imani J.

customer_reviews.title: Grew mold after a few uses (were not used incorrectly, followed instructions for use and care)
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to use these, since I wasn’t happy with how much garbage I was producing with disposable ones, but it quickly turned into disappointment. While these were super absorbent and leakproof, I was disappointed to see after several uses that a few of them started to grow mold in the seams and then it spread outwards. I washed them following the care instructions and used them as instructed... disappointing for sure!! I’ve attached pictures, at first I thought it was just the stitching, but it slowly got worse, and became obvious that it’s mold, gross! You can see in one picture the difference between the moldy one and the no moldy.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I'm not happy with this product at all. The pads are large and soft, and the bag they come in is nice. But after they get wet they feel really wet and gross. You have to change them right after you leak in them. Also, I've laundered them exactly as instructed and they stink really bad after your milk leaks on them. I've used similar disposable nursing pads and they don't smell at all, just like breastmilk, but these smell awful. These also get itchy after they're wet and they stick to you. I can't use these at all, very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Abrupt

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I bought these pads in addition to the Bamboobies brand so that I could test them out. I had hoped they’d actually be waterproof, but these have leaked each time I’ve worn them! Even if they’re not soaked they’ve leaked through the back. No waterproof backing whatsoever. Waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE these! I am so glad I tried these when I ran out of the throw away kind! They aren't too thick or bulky. They don't leak or itch. I wash them with the baby's clothes (not for any particular reason, I've washed them with our clothes and they've come out just fine) I've had them for about a month now and haven't had any issues. I'm definitely adding these to the list of things to buy other first time moms if they'll be nursing!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Hewitt

customer_reviews.title: Much softer and more eco-friendly than disposable pads
customer_reviews.text: I found these to be easy-to-use and quite effective for everyday use overnight, around the house, and out-and-about. I tend to change them often and go through all 8 in a day (we do a small daily load of baby stuff and I wash these with that). They are much softer than the disposable pad options (which to me felt like sandpaper --- ouch!). They fit well inside my nursing bra and make it possible for me to wash those once a week instead of daily. I also find that they have a modest, smooth profile so that they aren't obvious under my t-shirt and I feel comfortable wearing them outside. Overall, no complaints, these are great!
customer_reviews.author: Lana Yarosh

customer_reviews.title: Not absorbant
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like these but sadly I don't. After one leakage they already need to be changed as they become wet, uncomfortable, and sticky. I then feel disgusting for hours as they never dry. They really need to be changed after every single use-but that would take three orders of these just to do the job and I'd still be washing all of them every single day. On top of that, after washing them a few times the fabric becomes slightly 'crunchy' and rough. I'm going to be sticking with my disposable pads which I can wear all day with no retained moisture.
customer_reviews.author: meeks

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but not for heavy leakers.
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping these would be able to replace the disposable pads I use, but they aren’t for people that leak a lot or have a baby that sleeps most of the night. I didn’t find these super absorbent even after a few washes. I will most likely use them when I can, but they really aren’t comparable to the absorbency of the Lansinoh disposable ones that I currently use. They are a nice size and soft. They also aren’t super noticeable under most clothing.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, LARGE breast pads!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these breast pads! I was using the Medula breast pads; however, they were rough on my nipples. So I decided to try these and I really like how soft they feel against my sensitive skin. Pre-pregnancy I was a 34B, and my breasts didn't get much larger during or post pregnancy and the pads cover almost if not my whole breast which could be an issue if one is just wearing regular bras rather than nursing bras. Yet, I like them and I definitely recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: L.C.A

customer_reviews.title: Would NOT RECOMMEND
customer_reviews.text: I am by no means a heavy leaker in fact I have never leaked prior to using this product. I woke up to my shirt, bra and pad being completely soaked. I was really surprised because the disposable pads I’d been using had never caused me to leak or even feel any kind of moisture. I don’t produce very much so I can’t even imagine the leakage if I did. I would NOT RECOMMEND these to anyone. I was trying to be economical by purchasing these but i guess I’ll just go back to the disposable pads.
customer_reviews.author: kriskrause

customer_reviews.title: Ouch...Sticks
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product to decrease my use of disposable nursing pads. I have minimal leakage so the product did a good job with absorbency. However, the material wasn't as soft as I would have liked. It felt more like a cheap bath towel. I was expecting the material to be smooth not like a terry cloth material. If I did have minimal leaking (a few drops) my nipples would stick to the fabric. This still occurred after I applied moisturizers such as lanolin to the area. The removal of the pad after it sticks hurts. Unfortunately I can't return the product and I will not continue to use it. I'll just have to return to using disposable pads.
customer_reviews.author: KAlex

customer_reviews.title: Absorbent and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Bought two sets of these and also used some disposable and bambooboobies. These were my favorite. Not as extra soft at bambooboobies but super absorbent and almost never leaked through. Did not show through my lightly lines nursing bras. Washed in a bra bag after each use and used daily for 6 months. Still enough life to probably use them again in the future. Little zipper pouch was nice for travel to keep them all together and store in my pumping bag.
customer_reviews.author: rebekah kohn

customer_reviews.title: itchy but no leaking
customer_reviews.text: I waited at least 5 times of washing and wearing these before writing a review and they are still itchy. When wearing them under bras you can still see the outline of the pad. I got them specifically to wear under real clothes when going back to work and now I’ll have to figure out a different option. They are really itchy at first. After washing them several times the itchiness only goes down a little bit but doesn’t go away. Expect for them to stay itchy. The pro is that I’ve never had them leak through!
customer_reviews.author: KRye

customer_reviews.title: Very soft and gentle on sore skin
customer_reviews.text: These are incredibly soft. I get really sore when I start out nursing. I don’t know what it is but my babies all have tiny little mouths and I crack and am extremely tender for weeks after I begin nursing. These are/were so soft and felt so nice against my sore skin. I also over produce milk at first and these survived the entire night without needing to be changed. Color wise they haven’t blemished yet in the first few weeks of use. They seem to get clean and don’t smell after washings.
customer_reviews.author: Michael and Mary Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Game changing!
customer_reviews.text: These have been amazing for me, a first time mom, not knowing what actually happens in the beginning stages of breastfeeding. They are super soft and don’t bother my sore nipples. They absorb really well and I can wear them all day without issue. Much better than the disposables and much more comfortable. Every new mom needs these!
customer_reviews.author: cara rodman

customer_reviews.title: Nursing essential item
customer_reviews.text: As much as I like disposable nursing pads, it wasn’t great throwing them out constantly after a few hours so This product is definitely a great alternative. The pads are soft and doesn’t stick too much to the skin. They do feel wet once it’s been soak up to a certain point, but I haven’t experienced any leaks yet. I recommend at least getting 2-3 packs if you don’t do laundry too often. When washing, put it in a mesh bag to avoid it getting sucked into your washing machine’s water drain as well as not getting stuck on any of your baby’s stuff with Velcro.
customer_reviews.author: LP

customer_reviews.title: Very nice after a few washes
customer_reviews.text: At first I was not a huge fan of these, they seemed a little stiff at first and it seemed like they weren't drying out very easy, my skin felt wet against them. I was afraid of getting thrush from the dampness. But after several washes they have become very soft and more absorbent and my skin no longer feels moist under them. I leak a decent amount when I'm nursing and these have been able to absorb it all. I love the nice zipper pouch to keep them in. Make sure not to use fabric softener sheets with these as it can mess up how absorbent they are.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Love these
customer_reviews.text: I love these, they're still pretty noticeable under my bra but when I wear a compression nursing tank they're not quite as noticeable. I think it's the stitching around the outside that makes them that way, but they have the thinnest stitching I've come across besides bamboobies, but these are far more absorbent. They are slightly contoured, but not cone shaped which is not flattering either. So they fit nicely on my breasts. I havent experienced leaks with these, and the stay in place well. They are super soft too.
customer_reviews.author: Jaryn

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Love that these are organic and reusable. They do slip around a bit in my bra. My nipple will also stick to them and I have to peel it off. It doesn't hurt but it's not super fun and it leaves little fuzzy bits on your nip that you have to remove. I have washed them a few times. The stitching has started to come undone on one of them and they do attract a lot of laundry lint. Overall I like them a lot and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.text: Wish I had ordered these sooner and knew of them with my first born. I’ve tried other washable nursing pads before and they all seemed to always leak! Especially avent brand. I nursed my first born for two years and used disposables for two years because the washable ones I tried always leaked.. I went through sooo many nursing pads. With my second, Ive been nursing for 6 months now and decided to give washables another try. So glad that I found this one because it truly is so great! Will definitely order more and recommend these to every nursing mom— especially if you produce a lot. No leakage.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Carrier

customer_reviews.title: Fit comfortable and do not leak!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! So I got a few types of washable nursing pads and these are by far my favorite. I actually just came online to order more and thought I should leave a review. I leak alot. So it is important to me that it doesnt leak through and these do not dissappoint. They are soft and larger around than others I have ordered. Also, i live that they are absorbent without being thick. The smaller round thick pads show through my shirts. I just throw them in the wash with my regular clothes. They have held up well. My little one is 3 months old and these are by far my favorite.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, better value elsewhere.
customer_reviews.text: Great idea but you can purchase knock offs for much cheaper, get more pads for the same or less and theyre the same. I cannot distinguish between these and the knock offs. My knock offs also came with a mesh bag in addition to the waterproof wet bag for them. I loved that because l could toss them in the mesh bag and throw it into the wash and dryer and not have to dig through the laundry to find these lil guys. If you think socks are bad, these are similar. Lol.
customer_reviews.author: Jillian S.

customer_reviews.title: A little itchy, but they work in a pinch.
customer_reviews.text: These pads are “okay.” They are thin compared to others I have tried, which is nice in that I don’t have to worry about whether it’s noticeable I’m wearing any, but I also have to change them out more often. They’re also itchy compared to others I’ve tried, but they work in a pinch. I can stand to wear them for several hours, so if my other ones are in the wash, I use these as backups. The storage bag is a better product than the pads themselves in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Alanna

customer_reviews.title: I LOVVVVE THESE!!
customer_reviews.text: These are AWESOME! I do not leak through the pad, you cannot see the pad shape through my shirts, unless my shirts are tight. Overall I’m really really satisfied and I would definitely buy again!! When my breast get full they leak, a lot! I was waking up with the whole front of my shirt soaked because my other pads would leak through. With these pads it doesn’t happen anymore. They hold the excess milk and they don’t leak through. They’re comfortable and I’m so happy I bought these. The carrying case is perfect, that’s where I store my clean ones so I always know where they are.
customer_reviews.author: Xocasil

customer_reviews.title: Best reusable breast pads I’ve found
customer_reviews.text: I have so much milk I would leak constantly. I was allergic to the disposable ones plus I didn’t like the harm they did to the environment so I tried these. I use them daily and hand wash them at night or throw them in the delicate cycle. Only complain is I wish they were slightly softer. They only sort of stain with the milk
customer_reviews.author: jencb211

customer_reviews.title: Contoured to fit flat against your breast! Best pads!
customer_reviews.text: I love these ones. I ordered another brand that had more of them and were a little cheaper but they aren’t as nice as these because these ones have a seam sewn in to make it contoured to fit your breast, the other ones I bought that were similar to these don’t have that so they pucker or wrinkle up under my bra and don’t fit flat it’s very annoying. These are awesome, I would buy more of these or buy these again. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: AshleyMomof3BOYS

customer_reviews.title: Soft, absorbent & comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These reusable pads are soft, comfortable and absorbent. I do not leak usually a lot during the daytime, but feel glad having the extra protection just in case. They do slide around a little and they are visible under thin fabric shirts or through a unlined nursing bra but overall I like them alot. I machine wash in a smaller zippered garment bag (with my babys socks) and remove when they are about 90% dry to lay flat and air dry the rest of the way. Works well for me. I am happy with my purchase and would recommend these re-usable pads to others.
customer_reviews.author: Kurbz

customer_reviews.title: Makes squishy sound... but ok
customer_reviews.text: I have oversupply, so I definitely need to use these type of pads every single day, every single hour. These ones make a strange sound before using, once in place you don't hear it anymore. After washing them the first time, they are left with small fluff balls on the breast side that either stick to your breast or to your baby's mouth if you don't have a lint roll to pass over them. I would not recommend it if you have the option to pay a little bit more, if not, they'll do the work.
customer_reviews.author: rossc264

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: After only using these 4 months, they started coming apart at the seams. The Bamboobies pads I've had for over 4 years are still going strong and these are done in 4 months. Their defective warranty is only for the first 90 days. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: EmilyMy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect absorption for everyday use
customer_reviews.text: I go through a pair of these a day on average. Once things regulated I didn't leak very much unless my baby was feeding so these are perfect. I actually bought 2 sets because I like them so much over disposable ones. I wear them overnight and stretch them pretty far, but they hold a lot of liquid! I've only had problems on days where I work and go a long time between feedings. Make sure to change them once they get wet though because they begin to smell.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Breathable and super soft!
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite nursing pads I’ve tried. The disposable ones are hot and scratchy not to mention bad for the environment. I tried a different brand that was less expensive and had more pairs for the money, and although they were just as soft (bamboo) they were so hot and didn’t breathe like the Kindred ones that I ended up not using them and purchased more of the Kindred Bravely pads. They also help contain leaks and although they are not completely invisible in the bra, they are less noticeable when wearing a slightly padded bra. Buy these if you are looking for reusable breast pads, you will not be unsatisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Bryniarski

customer_reviews.title: Scratchy
customer_reviews.text: Cons: Could not stand the feel of these against my skin. I found myself pulling them out constantly to get relief. Pros: Worked to prevent leaks. The dart helped to make them conform and they are less visible than those without darts (although still not invisible) Purchased the bravado pads for nighttime as they have a mesh layer on inside which allows me to forget I'm wearing them. The bravado pads unfortunately are flat and would be visible under some tops. Alternatively Knix makes a pad that truly conforms, similar to the cup liners in swimsuits and would be great option for those situations where it's needed.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Do not fit normal breasts!
customer_reviews.text: These seem to be absorbent pads, but I’m confused to why they are flat. Women’s breasts aren’t flat. They aren’t fit for the curves of normal breasts. They bunch up because they are not curved. They need to be slightly 3 dimensional in order to fit properly. Also the outer stitching is causing me to itch really bad. A friend of mine made me some pads that fit perfect! No bunching. I’m a little confused why the reviews are so high. They absorb great and are durable but not comfortable or properly designed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor absorbency and security
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to buy these when I came across them! I wanted to help the environment & save money, but after a month of giving these a go, I am sadly disappointed. They shift in my nicely fitted bra, & they do not absorb well. They make my boobs feel wet, I go through a few tops a day, & they cause me to have to change my sheets frequently. I’ve followed the written care instructions that came with them, so I’m not sure why I’m having a bad experience.
customer_reviews.author: Devon Ferro

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I spent tons of money buying disposable pads. These are my 1st reusable pads. They cover a great amount of my breasts (38DD) thin enough to be discrete and don’t bulk up like the disposable kind do when they’re full of milk. I like the little pouch they come with. I also carry a small ziplock bag for the wet ones. They are very absorbent from what I’ve experienced so far. I hand washed the 1st pair with mild soap and rinsed then well, placed them on a rack in my bathroom to air dry. Haven’t tried the washing machine yet. So far so good. And there inexpensive too
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: I buy these for everyone!
customer_reviews.text: These have been my go-to reusable breast pads for three years now. I used them myself with my last two and have included them in every mommy to be gift I've put together for friends and family. Everyone I've given them to asks me where I've bought them bc they love them too! Very soft, holds shape after several washes, never leaks (I'm not a big leaker myself though), very cute bag to store in your diaper bag too.
customer_reviews.author: Haley C.

customer_reviews.title: Eh, they are okay. Probably wouldn’t buy again.
customer_reviews.text: I tried to love these, but ultimately think disposables are better. Even cheap diapers are better. You have to change these frequently or else they smell terrible and stay wet against your skin (this pack would only last a day or two). I did not have any leak problems, but I expected them to wick away moisture. Also, the pads do show through thinner bras and look frumpy. As a positive, however, they do get more soft as you wash and dry them.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Hatch

customer_reviews.title: Soft and leak-proof!
customer_reviews.text: These are very soft pads. The contour stitch is great too. They are very absorbent as I have a very heavy let down. I used to have to put a folded up burp cloth in my bra while nursing because I would leak through my old pads. These hold up well and I don’t leak through them. I just change them out afterward. I do however wish they came with an extra pair of pads at least. I’d be much happier for 6 or 7 pairs but at least 5. 4 seems off.
customer_reviews.author: Erika

customer_reviews.title: Best nursing pads! Better than Bamboobies!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best nursing pads I have ever used!! Hands down, better than Bamboobies, and disposables. My nipples were bleeding and so sore with my third daughter, and I purchased these pads based on the great reviews and I am so glad I did. I just ordered a second pack so I can have more clean on hand. These do not hurt my nipples when taking them off like the disposables would (disposables would stick-ouch!) I think they are way more absorbent than the Bamboobies brand, and they are cheaper and you get more! I’ve washed them several times already and they hold up great in the wash.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie G

customer_reviews.title: These are nice but mislead me
customer_reviews.text: These are nice but mislead me. I’m nursing my fifth child and have tried numerous nursing pads throughout the years. When I read about these I thought they would curve onto my breast so they wouldn’t bunch up... but they bunch up! You can see them through my shirts. If the bunching up doesn’t concern you, then you might like these because they are made very nice. High quality materials. They also came with a nice little bag to hold them. They were delivered as expected. If this company were to fix the shape, I would definitely order from them.
customer_reviews.author: Scalzy

customer_reviews.title: Really absorbent!
customer_reviews.text: These were a lifesaver for me! I was tired of constantly having to change my tops/bras due to leaking.I would use disposable pads but I hated having to switch them out all the time and getting that wet feeling was annoying. With these it was different, I don’t feel them Wet or dry and they last more between changes because they’re really absorbent . loveee that they come in a convenient cute bag for on the go !
customer_reviews.author: Lizette

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't recommend it. The edges are too thick. The pads are visible with a nursing bra. Not good when you wear a tight top. Once the pad is getting wet it stays wet and you have to change it immediately otherwise will start smelling. There is no adhesive material on the outside of the pads so they always move around, sometimes coming out of the bra.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: No comparison!
customer_reviews.text: Comparing to Bamboobies these don't even compare! The only pros are the price point and the carrying bag. I found these itchy, very visible under clothing, and smaller than other brands. The main reason I won't use these anymore is that they don't wick away any moisture, leaving a perfect environment for yeast. Not worth the risk!
customer_reviews.author: S.M.A.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic nursing pads. Subtracted one star because company has emailed twice already requesting feedback (& I bought and received these this month). Just had my baby (hence why I bought nursing pads) and suffered postpartum preeclampsia- in and out of hospital in the less than 2 weeks I’ve been postpartum. Company needs to realize- especially as a mother- sometimes getting around to these things takes time an only one feedback request is appropriate.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: No more stuck nipples!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I tried the disposable pads, stuck to my nipples, I tried a five dollar pair of pads from Walmart, stuck to my nipples. Finally got these in the mail wash them as directed and finally I found a pad that does not stick to my nipples!!! I’ve only been breast-feeding for about a week and usually I don’t leak a lot of milk so I can’t speak on the Absorbency of them. But honestly these are by far the best I’ve had
customer_reviews.author: Tee Graf

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price and super soft!
customer_reviews.text: Love these nursing pads! Great value for the price. They are contoured just enough to fit and stay in place much better than some disposables and other washable nursing pads I've used. They are incredibly soft! I was skeptical about how much they would hold without leaking. The only time I've leaked is when one has slipped out of place in the middle of the night.. but that's probably because I didn't place it on well after a 2 am feeding (you know how it is!). I've washed them lots of times now. They get a little bit pilly but still look, feel and work just as well as the first use.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: these are the best. They don't stick to your body after applying ...
customer_reviews.text: Buy it. Buy it now. Order 2. I have tried several brands and types of nursing pads, these are the best. They don't stick to your body after applying cream. They hold moisture well. Don't stain easily. Wash very very well. Don't shrink after placing them in the dryer. A must have for mothers who plan to breastfeed their baby. Would give as a gift without second thought. I would purchase a couple of sets. I am going to order another as I only what to use these and cringe when I haven'the done laundry to have a clean pair. Oh, how did I forget the cutexponents wet bag!!!!
customer_reviews.author: K Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Discrete, Comfortable and Effective
customer_reviews.text: The curved design on these is the best! These are super comfy and seem to absorb about the same amount as the Lanisoh disposable. They are thicker than disposable but look fine with a lightly padded bra. The outline will show in a non padded bra with a fitted shirt. I was using disposable but was getting so tired of all the garbage and the sticky side sticking to my sensitive nipple skin instead of my bra! These work great! I have leaked out of these - but I also have leaked out of the disposable pads in a similar scenario so... (both overnight when baby slept through)
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: I had my first baby in April and thought about the washable pads but figured it would be more difficult and time consuming than the disposables. After about a month of the disposables and being uncomfortable and irritated because they wouldn't stick, I bought these and I'm so glad I did! So soft and comfortable and I just wash them whenever I throw in a load of baby clothes! I definitely won't go back! Would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Mindy Adams

customer_reviews.title: Love these - super soft!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these when I was pregnant and had also ordered the disposable pads too because I figured I would not get around to washing these that often. I did not use them until my baby was almost two months and I wish I did not wait that long! They are soooo comfy and absorbent. i have not had any issues with leakage. I also just throw this in with the baby's clothes which I end up washing a load of every 2 days or so that way I always have a pair available to use.
customer_reviews.author: mali

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t absorb for me
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time using nondisposable nursing pads so to be fair to this product, it may just not be a good idea in general. However, I can only rate what I used. These were not absorbing whatsoever. Within one leak, I was soaked. The other big downside is that they would then stick to my nipples and I would have to peel them off like a bandaid which felt great of course. They are soft, easy to use and clean and made for a much better shape than disposables but I’m not sure who these would work for.
customer_reviews.author: Reid

customer_reviews.title: Leaks and rough on nipples
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because it’s organic and would lessen carbon footprint with less trash from disposable versions. However I used it for the first time and it felt rough against my nipples almost like sandpaper that it turned red and sore. At night it leaked through the pads, all over my bra and onto my night shirt. This doesn’t happen with the Medela or lansinoh disposable nursing pads.
customer_reviews.author: ( ‘_’ )

customer_reviews.title: Would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.text: These have held up great over the last year! I wish I would have had these for my first baby, it would have saved a lot on disposable pads. Would make a great baby shower gift! I have a pretty strong let down and sometimes leaked through a disposable on the opposite side, but have never leaked through these! Even at night they do a great job, they've stayed soft and absorbent and never have a bad smell. Easy to clean in a regular wash with kids or my clothes, but sometimes have to dry them an extra 10 minutes when I take out other clothes to make sure they don't retain any moisture in the center.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda P.

customer_reviews.title: MUCH better than the disposable ones!
customer_reviews.text: I’m so glad I bought these prior to giving birth. I received so many samples of the lasinoh brand disposable breast pads and they were awful! They always scrunched up inside of my bra and were itchy. And every time you wanted a new one you would have to open up the packaging and take the stickers off. But NOT THESE! Just stick them inside of your bra and they stay put forever. They’re super absorbent and you can keep putting them in the wash and reuse them. Such a good buy!
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for newborn nursing and overnight!
customer_reviews.text: Not the softest nursing pads, but very absorbent. Found to work well for over night nursing pads. Don’t even bother with bamboobies brand overnight nursing pads, these ones work way better even though they don’t advertise as overnight! Only thing I found to be kind of annoying is these are kind of thick in the bra, tend to be able to notice the shape of them in light colored clothing but if wearing loser clothing or just using at home, they are great. These are great for the newborn nursing stage.
customer_reviews.author: The H Family

customer_reviews.title: Just buy them
customer_reviews.text: These nursing pads are amazing! I have ordered 3 sets because let’s just say I go through them fast. Not because they don’t absorb much but because I don’t like putting them back on after pumping or feeding if they are wet. Gotta stay clean and dry! I love that these can just be thrown in the wash and I don’t have to waste disposable nursing pads. If you’re contemplating buying these nursing pads just buy them!
customer_reviews.author: Alison

customer_reviews.title: Overall good reusable pad.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time using reusable nursing pads, so my review may be more focused on reusable pads themselves instead of this particular brand of product. I formally used Lansinoh disposable pads which I liked but decided I was creating too much trash. These are comfortable, I don’t notice that I’m wearing them. In comparison to disposable pads I find these do shift some, but I guess that is what happens when there’s no adhesive backing. And compared to disposable ones there is a slight sour milk odor to them at the end of the day. I don’t have a big leaking problem but for what I experience they absorb good.
customer_reviews.author: xibbie

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I tested these after the death of my baby unfortunately and never got to use them after my pregnancy ended. They work great and I recommend them over any synthetic brand like Lansinoh brands with and organic nipple cream to soothe the soreness. My first child had breastfed and organic treated us far better after learning about all the harmful dyes and chemicals added to our cosmetics, hygiene products and our foods!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Needs better absorbency
customer_reviews.text: These breast pads are soft and thick. They are not waterproof so beware if you have a lot of leakage. They can stick to your nipple, making you raw and leave little fibers as a treat for baby. Yuck. If you have large boobs I recommend finding a larger size or making sure you have a padded bra over top as these are VERY visible through clothes otherwise. I don’t recommend these if you leak a lot, unless you want to change these every couple hours. They stick once they are wet, but they are comfortable and get the job done under normal circumstances.
customer_reviews.author: Ivana Cherie

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to like them more disposable pads but I couldn’t
customer_reviews.text: I was trying to be environmentally friendly by buying these pads but they just don’t work as well as disposable pads (specifically the Lansinoh pads) do to be honest. These pads do soak up leaking milk but it just feels like you have a thin wet towel in your bra. I’m torn, because I know the disposable pads are more costly and wasteful, but these pads just aren’t as good at wicking away the milk and making you feel dry
customer_reviews.author: Beka Hilton

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I love these pads. I haven’t had any leakage with them and I’ve been using them for more the now. It comes with a nice zippered bag that I use to have them hung above my dresser so I just grab them and go when I hop out of the shower. I wear them all day and night. They are extremely soft so my nipples aren’t tender against them. I wanted to stay away from disposable breast pads so after the first couple of weeks I found these and I’m happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: NicNac

customer_reviews.title: The other reviews must be fake
customer_reviews.text: These pads are awful. They get sopping wet and do not wick away moisture at all. I have to change them multiple times a day which is not working. They leak through to my shirt and do not get dry. Ever. I do not understand these other reviews. I’m not a super big leaker and I can’t use these. The other reviews have to be fake. If I could give zero stars I would!
customer_reviews.author: Megan Woodard

customer_reviews.title: A must have for breastfeeding moms!
customer_reviews.text: All moms to be.. you need this!!! Especially for the first three months it will make your life so much easier.. I strongly recommend this one because they are organic cotton supper soft and perfect size because some are just too large and not as soft, I tried a couple and this is the one I would recommend. They come with a cute little bag.
customer_reviews.author: Tila K

customer_reviews.title: Super absorbent, no leak, extremely soft
customer_reviews.text: Best breast pads I’ve found. Extremely soft, even if you leak on them. I never leaked through my clothes when I had them on. The price was amazing for the quality. I have since purchased more kindred bravely products because of these simple breast pads. I purchase them for my friends having babies as well. Definitely a must have if you plan on trying to breast feed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: solid choice but not my favorite
customer_reviews.text: Love the size and absorbency of these pads. However, they’re not as soft as other brands and are thicker sizes more visible under a nursing bra/tank top. Sometimes, the pads have stuck to my skin which could be annoying if your nipples are irritated from nursing. The carrying bag is nice to keep them organized and clean until ready to use. A solid choice for pads but not my favorite.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie

customer_reviews.title: Rough and sticks to tender nipple skin
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for these after reading the reviews, but was very disappointed. The pads are not soft after the initial wash. They have a rough texture that sticks to nipples and can be quite painful to detach. I did follow the washing instructions. These are also quite thick and show through any bras. Will not recommend or purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Breanna

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t love these
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love these but I found them to move around a lot. I also thought they were really itchy. I definitely preferred the disposables. But the packaging was cute and easy to wash.
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: Much more comfortable than disposable!
customer_reviews.text: I love these so much I ended up ordering a total of 32 pads/16 pairs! I probably change mine out more frequently than the average person but I just can't stand to reapply a wet nursing pad. Disposable nursing pads irritate my skin too much, but these are soft and gentle on my skin and I can easily throw them in the wash with baby clothes. If you're doing everything "right" with nipple care and using disposable nursing pads but still feel that your nipples are irritated, just switch to these and you'll see an improvement.
customer_reviews.author: rpatrick

customer_reviews.title: Great Absorbency!
customer_reviews.text: Wife here, just wanted to say that I absolutely love these pads, they were a life saver!!!! I started having some major leaking that started half way through my pregnancy. These were the solution! After I had the baby, my oversupply lead to constant, major leakage. These pads absorb amazingly! They're really soft and comfortable too which makes it even better! They are somewhat noticeable if you're wearing a soft shell bra or braless, but honestly, who cares. Would rather have a pad outline than puddle marks on my shirt. I ended up ordering two packs of these once I had my baby, just to make things easier for myself. Highly, highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Scott MacAdams

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Bother.
customer_reviews.text: These were less expensive that the brand everyone told me to get, and being organic, I definitely wanted to give them a try. I’ve had them for months now and they were so not worth the extra money I saved. The hem becomes all warped after a few washes, meaning you can always see them under your shirt and bra. The hem also irritates my skin (by scratching it) and it’s uncomfortable. They are bulky and not very soft. I ended up buying the better brand and loving them.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Leaked through
customer_reviews.text: These are great for leaking beasts to a certain extent. Depending on how much you're leaking you will have to replace them quite often. And it just goes through after a while. They work, but not as well as I would have thought. Even as I was trying to let my milk dry up, I still leaked through often. Just do your research.
customer_reviews.author: TheMaster

customer_reviews.title: “Mommy you stink”
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like and use these so bad because I felt guilty using disposable but these smell awful after you hand wash them and hang dry. It’s the smell of moist kept in water. So awful my toddler said mommy you stink. My heart sunk and knew I needed to get rid of them. They’re very cute though in the bag and I like the idea so I gave one star. Also not great for overnight sleep. You’ll wake up with soaked boobs and night shirt. These are meant to be changed often — but how while I sleep?!
customer_reviews.author: MN

customer_reviews.title: Absorbent but had obvious outline
customer_reviews.text: These were ok. I wish they had a more seamless edge as you could see the outline through shirts. As well as they folded a bit with the contours of my breasts (36DDD when my milk came in). Ended up wearing them at night and around the house but would switch to disposables if I was going out and cared about the outline. Generally they were absorbent and comfortable though.
customer_reviews.author: KT

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly pleased with how these have held up and worked for me
customer_reviews.text: These are the best breast pads I own. Not only are they not super obvious under clothing, they have never leaked on me. I remember getting brands in the past like Bamboobies that would not hold milk as much as I needed. These work fabulously. I don't need to swap these out during the day and would absolutely recommend them to others.
customer_reviews.author: Penny Swears

customer_reviews.title: A couple things I would change.
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of using disposable breast pads so I switched to cloth. I love the travel bag these came in, although I feel like they could have easily made it into a launder bag to keep you from eventually losing all the pads. It they are great however I always get lint stuck to my nipples and I have to wipe it off or make sure I'm lint free before I pop my breast into my sons mouth. These suggestions hopefully help the designers of the pads but nevertheless a good product and I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 2 times disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product 2 times. First time these pads worked fine until I noticed that black mold was growing into it. I thought it was because I didn't washed them properly, but no. Now the second time I buy these pads (its 2 months I've been using) and I notice that mold is growing in again. I followed the directions clearly. Also before feeding my baby I notice that it sometimes sticks to my nipple. Other than that it is soft and breaky noticable, but the mold is what makes it bad.
customer_reviews.author: Jessenia D.

customer_reviews.title: I love the waterproof side
customer_reviews.text: Two people recommended these nursing pads so I had to try them, and I agree that they are so wonderful! There is a waterproof side and the cloth side, so they don't leak out as other brands have done to me. They're a good size and thickness. They are a little bit lumpy, but I don't wear tight shirts so that doesn't matter to me. I am 100% pleased with these!
customer_reviews.author: DevotedMomWifeNurse

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: Loved These. Make sure to put them in a laundry bag while washing. I got one stuck in my washers hose stopping the machine from working. Oops. These helped so much while the disposables were not absorbent enough. I really appreciated not having to buy more and being able to just wash and reuse them. I loved the handy dandy travel bag it came with. I get these for my mama friends who have also loved them.
customer_reviews.author: José & Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: Cost effective
customer_reviews.text: Overall these are great. The included bag also comes in very handy. I don't have much leakage when wearing a bra therefore I consider these to be pretty absorbent. They are a little uncomfortable to wear once they are wet. I deducted a star though because of the fit. Im small chested and these do not lay well. They are visible through shirts.
customer_reviews.author: Sharlyne

customer_reviews.title: good size and absorption
customer_reviews.text: I am new to this, so it's possible I'm not changing them frequently enough, but I have had some problems with leak throughs. They are soft, but you definitely need at least 2 packs of these- I go through about al 8 in one day. Very soft and comfortable. They also help to act as a barrier between your bra and nipple when they're sore. You can see them through a shirt if you do not have a slightly padded bra (or if you remove the pad inserts from your nursing bra, but that is to be expected. Would recommend, just buy more than 1 pack!
customer_reviews.author: Liz F.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased my first Kindred Bravely products, the Soft French Terry Nursing Sleep Bra, the Simply Sublime Nursing Bra, and the Organic Washable Nursing Pads. I am in my second trimester, so I have not been able to test out the absorbency of the pads, they are thin and do not to look bulky under the nursing bras. I like that there is a waterproof case to hold wet pads. My favorite feature is the snap on the bag. They gained a lifelong customer, I will be recommending to all my friends.
customer_reviews.author: MuntzkinsMama

customer_reviews.title: Reliable but uncomfortable for sore nips
customer_reviews.text: I love that these are organic and reusable and I wanted so bad to love using them! They came in a super cute and useful carrying case and are reliably leakproof but they are just SO uncomfortable! My already sore nipples (hello 2 week old) were made exponentially more sore by wearing these. I have a pack of bamboobies overnights and they are much softer and more comfortable. Maybe when my nips aren't so beaten and battered, I'll come back to these but in the meantime, I'm opting for the bamboobies!
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Supersoft!
customer_reviews.text: Super soft! Love them! Just ordered a second package. My nipples were tender due to the challenges of first stages of breastfeeding and these are so soft, when I place those in I don't feel the pain at all! The touch of the cotton or the nylon in the tanks or bras were very uncomfortable but as long as I place these in I am good to go! I am over producing milk right now and the pads are great, don't feel them get milky or wet although they are all soaked in milk! Definitely recommend. Breastfeeding is tough enough and we deserve this treat! Worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Deniz Kiral

customer_reviews.title: Don’t try these if you love cotton ones.
customer_reviews.text: They hold in the milk well. Soft enough. I honestly just prefer cotton ones. I bought these because after 4 children, they discontinued the cottons ones I’ve bought every time. I find myself grabbing my old bag of cotton ones over these. They are nice enough and work fine, but I guess you just love what you love. If I hadn’t had cotton before, these would have been just fine.
customer_reviews.author: elle2947

customer_reviews.title: Not the best
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping to find some great reusable breast pads instead of throwing away countless disposable ones but unfortunately these just don't work for me. They do not wick the moisture away so you can feel the wetness and they stuck to me. I leak pretty heavily so maybe these will be better if you don't leak as much. They are very soft and hold up well to washing, though.
customer_reviews.author: Whitney R

customer_reviews.title: Love the idea of it being reusable.
customer_reviews.text: Love that it has a leak proof backing, however there is a smell to the material that I'm not liking too much. It's not too bad when it's dried but once its soaked you can smell it more, or maybe the mix of it with breast milk makes it more noticeable. Also, notice the edge/trim of the pads scratches my breasts and makes it itch.
customer_reviews.author: J vang

customer_reviews.title: I love!
customer_reviews.text: I just recently had my Little boy and trying to do nursing. I grabbed these pads for when more at home TT hen going through boxes of disposable ones. I really like these! I'm super sensitive skinned and was slightly worried they be a bit uncomfortable. But I was super pleasantly suprised with how soft these arre and comfortable to wear in the bra! They do really good at absorbing, and not leaking. The price is totally worth it especially when they come with a little bag to store them.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Heeney

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I love the storage. They wash great and don’t shrink. I started washing them in the shower, by hand, and they don’t loose shape. I air dry them amd they stay soft, Which is a biggie for me. I am a new mom therefore I am not producing more than 10 ounces of milk based on this is my review I am not sure if her mothers who are producing more they will work but they are very worth the try.
customer_reviews.author: FCM

customer_reviews.title: Soft, comfortable, ZERO leaks and well made.
customer_reviews.text: This might sound strange but it doesn't stick to your nips. Idk if that has happened to others but I actually had to peel a different brand off after some leakage occurred. It was painful. These are extremely absorbent and I have had zero leakage. I have washed them a ton of times and they come out soft and fluffy. They are made so well. I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Bruklyn

customer_reviews.title: Super leak proof and absorbent! You wont regret this purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I'll be honest, I was skeptical about buying washable nursing pads. I bought some with my oldest and they were horrible, but I decided to go with these after reading all the good reviews. I'm soooo glad I did!! They are the best nursing pads I've ever owned!! I couldnt get over how absorbant they are and super leak proof!!! I never had an accident! I highly recommend these breast pads!!
customer_reviews.author: KFow8

customer_reviews.title: Love these nursing pads!
customer_reviews.text: I am very satisfied with these nursing pads! They're easy to wash, come in a cute little bag, and reusable. They soak in a lot of milk during the time I am wearing them while out, and don't feel all wet and uncomfortable. In most all my bras they are not noticeable, which is nice since I will be returning to work soon! Look a little worn already after a few washes but I'd still take these over the disposable.
customer_reviews.author: cheryl stoyke

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good pads
customer_reviews.text: These breast pads certainly do their job but they’re not my favorite. Sometimes they feel a bit crust when I pull them out of the dryer and they don’t stay in place very well but that’s the nature of material pads. Other than that I like them. They just don’t wash super well and sometimes they get uncomfortable when they’re wet.
customer_reviews.author: Rochelle

customer_reviews.title: Great for every day!
customer_reviews.text: My wife bought these so she could have more nursing pads to use throughout the week. She loves them! They’re very soft and absorbent. The back is a leak-proof material so she doesn’t have to worry about and leaks showing through her shirt, which has happened with different reusable pads. The carrying case they come with is also great for when we travel! She can just put the pads she needs inside it and doesn’t have to go searching for them in our suitcase. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Dude

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic, durable product!
customer_reviews.text: These have enabled me to breastfeed for almost six months without a single instance of mastitis or thrush. They wick moisture away very quickly and get even softer the more you wash them. I honestly can’t imaging using disposable pads when these are so easy to use. Only drawback is they are definitely pretty lumpy. Husband says I look like old school Lara Croft (e.g. squared off boobs) when I wear them. But who am I trying to impress? I just need to stay dry!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Eco Friendly
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to be a little eco friendly with the reusable breast pads, and these are great. They aren't the softest after being washed numerous times, but def prefer these to the one time use ones. Absorb pretty well, I've never been one to leak an excess amount, so over-suppliers may say different as far as absorbency goes.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel  Kmiec

customer_reviews.title: Works well with only one issue
customer_reviews.text: I really like these pads and am so glad to not be constantly adding waste to a landfill with disposable pads. However, I normally wear a nursing camisole with a tank top over it and you can totally see the large circle of the pads through my shirts. This doesn’t bother me at home but is kind of embarrassing when I’m out. It’s not always convenient in the summer to wear thicker clothes just to conceal my nursing pads. Other then that I love them!
customer_reviews.author: David R warren

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I needed. Works great in all of my bras. I love that I'm not wasting money on disposable pads that don't stay in place. I just toss these in the wash ( I put them in a bag for delicates) and they are ready to go again. Also appreciate the cute little bag they come in. I didn't even realize I was ordering from Kindred Bravely. I love their nursing bras. Great company with high quality products.
customer_reviews.author: Cappylove

customer_reviews.title: Love these! Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable and absorbent and I don't have to feel bad throwing away all the disposable ones! I've washed them 3 times now and so far so good! They don't crumple, and the backs are smooth and not noticeable through my nursing bra+shirt.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Do not sleep in half waterproof breast pads
customer_reviews.text: Be careful buying the half waterproof kind- these keep your nipples wet. It is better to buy the non waterproof kind if you are not wearing them at work. Do not sleep in these. This will contribute to painful nipples. But they are great for daytime use when you know you are wet
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

product_meta.title: Organic Washable Breast Pads 8 Pack | Reusable Nursing Pads for Breastfeeding with Carry Bag
feature_bullets: ULTRA-SOFT AND HYPOALLERGENIC: Made of the softest bamboo, these nursing pads are more absorbent and durable than cotton, and they offer superior comfort for chafed or sore nipples and nursing mothers’ sensitive skin.
ENVIRONMENTALLY FRIENDLY: Unlike disposable nursing pads, these washable breast pads can be reused day after day, saving you money and reducing waste. Simply machine wash and tumble dry between uses.

CONTOURED SHAPE: Designed by moms for moms, these breast pads feature a clever contoured shape to fit smoothly and discreetly in your nursing bras. The waterproof backing protects your nursing bra and shirt from leaks.

NURSING MOM ESSENTIAL: The organic nursing pads multipack includes 4 pairs (8 pads) so you can always have an extra pair in your diaper bag, purse, or nursing station. The included wet bag makes these reusable breast pads the perfect gift for a new mom.

SAFE FOR MOM & BABY: OEKO Tex certified, these pads have a 100% organic bamboo inner layer, a high-absorbency microfiber middle layer, and an outer layer made of waterproof PUL fabric, ensuring you and your baby are both safe and comfortable.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars4,356 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
